item.title: Foliage interfering with light, 27th September
item.description:
The light is covered by tree foliage. When I was putting out my rubbish there was a loud creaking as the branches where knocking into the light. The foliage is blocking out the light in an area where 2 other lights aren’t working. This area is very dark and feels unsafe.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Winchester Street, Pimlico, London

item.title: Formal Complaint: Deliberate and Persistent Dog Fouling by a Resident at Bexley Grammar School Yard!, 26th September
item.description:
To the Bexley Council, I am writing to express my utter disgust and anger regarding the wilful and persistent act of environmental vandalism being committed by Andrew Inglis of 82 Danson Lane, DA16 2BH. For some time, this individual has been using the school yard of Bexley Grammar School as his personal dumping ground for bagged dog waste. The most recent incident occurred around 11 PM on September 26, 2025, but this is far from an isolated event. Mr. Inglis regularly walks his small white dogs and, upon returning to his property, makes a conscious decision to hurl the used waste bags into the school grounds, often aiming for the large ship container. This is not an accident; it is a calculated and deeply antisocial act. This behaviour is absolutely reprehensible. It is a blatant disregard for basic decency, public health, and the well-being of the children who attend that school. The fact that an adult would deliberately fling bags of excrement into a place of learning is beyond contempt. It is a health hazard and an insult to the entire community. I demand that the council take immediate and decisive action. This is not a matter for a polite warning. Given the frequency and deliberate nature of these acts, a formal investigation and significant penalty are warranted. I urge you to inspect the area and take the necessary steps to put a stop to this disgusting behaviour once and for all. We pay our council taxes expecting that our public spaces, especially our schools, will be kept safe and clean. The council has a responsibility to enforce its own bylaws and protect the community from such irresponsible individuals. This situation is unacceptable, and we expect you to address it with the seriousness it deserves. I expect to be informed of the actions you intend to take. Sincerely, A local resident of the Bexley Council
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flags going up along Bexley High Street, 26th September
item.description:
Being new to the area, I was somewhat horrified to find Union Jacks going on half mast all along Bexley High Street today. I believe flags are meant to be a symbol of pride and identity, however, they used to be flown for specific events only. The recent developments in this country and the narrative around it seems to indicate that a deeper political agenda is pursuit here. As a none-English born citizen, I am terrified by this development. I am even more terrified by the statement on the council website „ we are not aware of the flags causing any immediate community tension“. As far as it appears, these flags are being put up illegally. The sheer ignorance of the council to not taking action may not cause any immediate tension now but this is how tension is created. When the tension is here, Bexley council will have failed. Personally, I feel a deep punch in the stomach because I am aware of the intentions behind the flags and find it disturbing that no action is taken. Can anyone go and put up their flags? Where will it stop?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 115, Bexley High Street, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bricks On Pavement, 26th September
item.description:
Someone has caused willful damage to the retaining wall & left the removed bricks in the middle of the pavement. They were too heavy for me to move. This has only occurred in the last 24 hours. I walked this way yesterday & there was no damage. Please check the CCTV on Methuen Road to find the culprit. There are often groups & individuals hanging about on this street waiting to do drug deals.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Methuen Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet
